v1NICID.description: The identifier (ID) of a network interface.
v1NICID.name: nicId

v1NetworkAreaID.description: The identifier (ID) of a STACKIT Network Area.
v1NetworkAreaID.name: areaId

v1NetworkID.description: The identifier (ID) of a STACKIT Network.
v1NetworkID.name: networkId

v1NetworkRangeID.description: The identifier (ID) of a STACKIT Network Range.
v1NetworkRangeID.name: networkRangeId

v1OrganizationID.description: The identifier (ID) of a STACKIT Organization.
v1OrganizationID.name: organizationId

v1ProjectID.description: The identifier (ID) of a STACKIT Project.
v1ProjectID.name: projectId

v1PublicIPID.description: The identifier (ID) of a Public IP.
v1PublicIPID.name: publicIpId

v1RequestID.description: The identifier (ID) of a STACKIT Request.
v1RequestID.name: requestId

v1RouteID.description: The identifier (ID) of a STACKIT Route.
v1RouteID.name: routeId

v1SecurityGroupID.description: The identifier (ID) of a STACKIT Security Group.
v1SecurityGroupID.name: securityGroupId

v1SecurityGroupRuleID.description: The identifier (ID) of a STACKIT Security Group Rule.
v1SecurityGroupRuleID.name: securityGroupRuleId

v1ServerID.description: The identifier (ID) of a STACKIT Server.
v1ServerID.name: serverId

v1ServiceAccountMail.description: The e-mail address of a service account.
v1ServiceAccountMail.name: serviceAccountMail

v1VolumeID.description: The identifier (ID) of a STACKIT Volume.
v1VolumeID.name: volumeId

value.msg: The affinity group policy is not supported
boot device size is not valid or missing
request body has an error: doesn't match schema: Error at "/name": value must be a string

InternalServerError.description: Internal Server Error, returns a 500 if something is broken on IaaS API Side.

ServerOrPublicIPNotFound.description: The server or public IP was not found.

Unauthorized.description: A request which was not authorized.

AddVolumeToServerPayload.description: Object that represents a Volume attachment to a server.

AllowedAddresses.description: A list of IPs or CIDR notations.

Area.description: The basic properties of a network area.

AreaDefaultPrefixLengthIPv4.description: The default prefix length for networks in the network area.

AreaMaxPrefixLengthIPv4.description: The maximal prefix length for networks in the network area.

AreaMinPrefixLengthIPv4.description: The minimal prefix length for networks in the network area.

AreaPrefixConfigIPv4.description: The IPv4 prefix config for a network area.

AvailabilityZone.description: Object that represents an availability zone.

BaseSecurityGroupRule.description: The base schema for a security group rule.

direction.description: The direction of the traffic which the rule should match.

ethertype.description: The ethertype which the rule should match.

ipRange.description: The remote IP range which the rule should match.

remoteSecurityGroupId.description: The remote security group which the rule should match.

BootVolume.description: The boot device for the server.

BootVolumeSource.description: The source object of a boot volume.

BootVolumeSourceTypes.description: The source types of a boot volume.

CreateAreaAddressFamily.description: The addressFamily object for a area create request.

CreateAreaIPv4.description: The config object for a IPv4 network area.

CreateNICPayload.description: Object that represents a network interface.

CreateNetworkAddressFamily.description: The addressFamily object for a network create request.

CreateNetworkIPv4Body.description: The config object for an IPv4 network.

CreateNetworkIPv6Body.description: The config object for an IPv6 network.

CreateNetworkPayload.description: Object that represents the request body for a network create.

CreateProtocol.description: The schema for a protocol when creating a security group rule.

CreatePublicIPPayload.description: Object that represents a public IP.

networkInterface.description: Associate the public IP with a network interface or a virtual IP (ID).

CreateSecurityGroupPayload.description: Object that represents a security group.

CreateSecurityGroupRulePayload.description: Object that represents a request body for security group rule creation.

CreateSecurityGroupRuleProtocol.description: The internet protocol which the rule should match.

CreateServerNetworking.description: The initial networking setup for the server creation with a network.

CreateServerNetworkingWithNics.description: The initial networking setup for the server creation with a network interface.

CreateServerPayload.description: Representation of a single server object.

affinityGroup.description: The affinity group the server is assigned to.

availabilityZone.description: This is the availability zone requested during server creation. If none is provided during the creation request and an existing volume will be used as boot volume it will be set to the same availability zone as the volume. For requests with no volumes involved it will be set to the metro availability zone.

keypairName.description: The SSH keypair used during the server creation.

machineType.description: Name of the machine type the server shall belong to.

networking.description: The initial networking setup for the server creation. A network, a nic or nothing can be given.

nics.description: The list of network interfaces (NICs) attached to the server. Only shown when detailed information is requested.

securityGroups.description: The initial security groups for the server creation.

serviceAccountMails.description: A list of service account mails. Only shown when detailed information is requested.

userData.description: User Data that is provided to the server. Must be base64 encoded and is passed via cloud-init to the server. Only shown when detailed information is requested.

volumes.description: The list of volumes attached to the server.

CreateVolumePayload.description: Object that represents a volume and its parameters. Used for Creating and returning (get/list).

DeleteOnTermination.description: Delete the volume during the termination of the server. Defaults to false.

Description.description: Description Object. Allows string up to 127 Characters.
Description.example: cool description dude. Wanna play some Snakeybus?

Error.description: Error with HTTP error code and an error message.

GenericName.description: The name for a General Object. Matches Names and also UUIDs.

code.description: ICMP code. Can be set if the protocol is ICMP.

type.description: ICMP type. Can be set if the protocol is ICMP.

IP.description: Object that represents an IP address.

IPv6.description: Object that represents an IPv6 address.

Labels.description: Object that represents the labels of an object.

MAC.description: Object that represents an MAC address.

NIC.description: Object that represents a network interface.

NICSecurity.description: If this is set to false, then no security groups will apply to this network interface.

Nameserver.description: A list containing DNS Servers/Nameservers for IPv4.

Nameserverv6.description: A list containing DNS Servers/Nameservers for IPv6.

NetworkArea.description: Object that represents a network area.

NetworkAreaIPv4.description: The IPv4 properties of a network area.

NetworkGateway.description: The gateway of a network. If not specified the first IP of the network will be assigned as the gateway. If 'null' is sent, then the network doesn't have a gateway.

NetworkRange.description: Object that represents a network range.

PartialUpdateNetworkPayload.description: Object that represents the request body for a network update.

PortRange.description: Object that represents a range of ports.

max.description: The maximum port number. Should be greater or equal to the minimum.

min.description: The minimum port number. Should be less or equal to the minimum.

ProjectCount.description: The amount of projects currently referencing a specific area.

Protocol.description: The schema for a protocol of a security group rule.

ProtocolName.description: The protocol name which the rule should match.

ProtocolNumber.description: The protocol number which the rule should match.

PublicIp.description: Object that represents a public IP.

networkInterface.description: Associate the public IP with a network interface or a virtual IP (ID).

ReqId.description: Identifier (ID) representing a single API request.

RequestResource.description: Object that represents a resource as part of a request.

Resource.description: Object that represents a resource type.

ResourceAction.description: Object that represents a resource action.

ResourceState.description: The state of a resource object.

Routed.description: Shows if the network is routed and therefore accessible from other networks.

SecurityGroup.description: Object that represents a security group.

SecurityGroupList.description: A list containing security group objects.

SecurityGroupRule.description: Object that represents a security group rule.

SecurityGroupRuleList.description: A list containing security group rule objects.

SecurityGroupRuleProtocol.description: The internet protocol which the rule matches.

Server.description: Representation of a single server object.

affinityGroup.description: The affinity group the server is assigned to.

availabilityZone.description: This is the availability zone requested during server creation. If none is provided during the creation request and an existing volume will be used as boot volume it will be set to the same availability zone as the volume. For requests with no volumes involved it will be set to the metro availability zone.

keypairName.description: The SSH keypair used during the server creation.

machineType.description: Name of the machine type the server shall belong to.

networking.description: The initial networking setup for the server creation. A network, a nic or nothing can be given.

nics.description: The list of network interfaces (NICs) attached to the server. Only shown when detailed information is requested.

securityGroups.description: The initial security groups for the server creation.

serviceAccountMails.description: A list of service account mails. Only shown when detailed information is requested.

userData.description: User Data that is provided to the server. Must be base64 encoded and is passed via cloud-init to the server. Only shown when detailed information is requested.

volumes.description: The list of volumes attached to the server.

ServerConsoleUrl.description: Object that represents a server console URL.

ServerListResponse.description: Response object for server list request.

ServerMaintenance.description: Object that represents the information about the next planned server maintenance window.

ServerNICList.description: A list of networks attached to a server.

ServerNetwork.description: Describes the object that matches servers to its networks.

nicSecurity.description: If this is set to false, then no security groups will apply to this server network interface.

ServerPowerStatus.description: The power status of a server.

ServerStatus.description: The status of a server object.

ServerUserData.description: User Data that is provided to the server. Must be base64 encoded and is passed via cloud-init to the server.

ServiceAccountMail.description: Object that represents an e-mail address of a service account.

ServiceAccountMailList.description: A list of service account mails.

Stateful.description: Shows if a security group is stateful or stateless. You can only have one type of security groups per network interface/server.

UpdateAreaAddressFamily.description: The addressFamily object for a area update request.

UpdateAreaIPv4.description: The update object for a IPv4 network area.

UpdateAttachedVolumePayload.description: Object that represents a Volume attachment to a server.

UpdateNICPayload.description: Object that represents a network interface update.

UpdateNetworkAddressFamily.description: The addressFamily object for a network update request.

UpdateNetworkAreaRoutePayload.description: Object that represents the request body for a route update.

UpdateNetworkIPv4Body.description: The config object for a IPv4 network update.

UpdateNetworkIPv6Body.description: The config object for a IPv6 network update.

UpdatePublicIPPayload.description: Object that represents a public IP.

networkInterface.description: Associate the public IP with a network interface or a virtual IP (ID).

UpdateSecurityGroupPayload.description: Object that represents an update request body of a security group.

UpdateServerPayload.description: Object that represents an update request body of a server.

UpdateVolumePayload.description: Object that represents an update request body of a  volume.

UpdatedAt.description: Date-time when resource was last updated.

Volume.description: Object that represents a volume and its parameters. Used for Creating and returning (get/list).

VolumeAttachment.description: Object that represents a Volume attachment to a server.

VolumeAttachmentList.description: A list containing Volume attachments of a server.

VolumeSource.description: The source object of a volume.

VolumeSourceTypes.description: The source types of a volume.

VolumeStatus.description: The status of a volume object.

info.description: This API allows you to create and modify IaaS resources.
info.title: IaaS-API

get.description: Get a list of all visible network areas defined in an organization.

200.description: Get a list of all network areas.

get.summary: List all network areas in an organization.

post.description: Create a new network area in an organization.

requestBody.description: Request an Area creation.

post.summary: Create new network area in an organization.

delete.description: Delete an existing network area in an organization. This is only possible if no projects are using the area anymore.

202.description: Delete request for area has been accepted.

get.description: Get details about a network area in an organization.
get.summary: Get details about a network area.

patch.description: Update the settings of a network area in an organization.

requestBody.description: Request to update an Area.

get.description: Get a list of all network ranges in a network area.
get.summary: List all network ranges in a network area.

post.description: Create a new network range in an existing network area.

requestBody.description: Request an addition of network ranges to an area.

post.summary: Create new network range in a network area.

delete.description: Delete a network range of a network area. The deletion will fail if the network range is still used.

202.description: Delete request for network range accepted.

get.description: Get details about a network range in a network area.
get.summary: Get details about a network range.

get.description: Get a list of all projects using a network area.

200.description: List projects for a network area.

get.summary: List all projects using a network area.

get.description: Get a list of all network routes defined in a network area.
get.summary: List all network routes in a network area.

post.description: Create one or several new network routes in a network area.

requestBody.description: Request an addition of routes to an area.

202.description: Create request for network routes accepted.

delete.description: Delete a network route of a network area.

202.description: Delete request for the network route has been accepted.

get.description: Get details about a network route defined in a network area.
get.summary: Get details about a network route.

patch.description: Update a network route defined in a network area.

requestBody.description: Request an update of a network route.

get.description: Lookup an organization request ID from a previous request. This allows to find resource IDs of resources generated during a organization request.
get.summary: Lookup an organization request ID.

get.description: Get a list of all networks inside a project.

200.description: List all networks of a project.

get.summary: List all networks inside a project.

post.description: Create a new network in a project. `nameservers` will be filled from `defaultNameservers` of the respective area if not specified. If the project has `internetAccess` enabled and this is the first network in the project this might incur cost.

requestBody.description: Request a network creation.

delete.description: Delete a network. If the network is still in use, the deletion will fail.

202.description: Delete request for network has been accepted.

get.description: Get details about a network of a project.
get.summary: Get network details.

patch.description: Update the settings of a network inside a project.

requestBody.description: Request an update of a network.

get.description: Get a list of all network interfaces inside a network.
get.summary: List all network interfaces inside a network.

post.description: Create a new network interface in a project.

requestBody.description: Request a network interface creation.

delete.description: Delete a network interface that is part of the project.

204.description: Network interface delete request has been accepted.

get.description: Get details about a network interface inside a network.
get.summary: Get details about a network interface.

patch.description: Update the properties of an existing network interface inside a network.

requestBody.description: Request an update of a network interface.

get.description: Get a list of all public IPs inside a project.
get.summary: List all public IPs inside a project.

post.description: Create a new public IP in a project.

requestBody.description: Request a public IP creation.

201.description: The public IP has been created.

delete.description: Delete a public IP that is part of the project.

204.description: The public IP has been deleted.

get.description: Get details about a public IP inside a project.
get.summary: Get details about a public IP.

patch.description: Update the properties of an existing public IP inside a project.

requestBody.description: Request an update of a public IP.

get.description: Lookup a project request ID from a previous request. This allows to find resource IDs of resources generated during a projects request.
get.summary: Lookup a project request ID.

get.description: Get a list of all security groups inside a project.

200.description: List all security groups of a project.

get.summary: List all security groups inside a project.

post.description: Create a new security group in a project.

requestBody.description: Request a security group creation.

201.description: Security group create has been accepted.

204.description: Delete request for security group has been accepted.

get.description: Get details about a security group of a project.
get.summary: Get security group details.

patch.description: Update labels of the security group.

requestBody.description: Request an update of a security group.

patch.summary: Update information of a security group.

get.description: Get a list of all rules inside a security group.

200.description: List all rules of a security group.

get.summary: List all rules for a security group.

post.description: Create a new security group rule in a project.

requestBody.description: Request for a security group rule creation.

201.description: Security group rule create has been accepted.

204.description: Delete request for security group rule has been accepted.

get.description: Get details about a security group rule of a project.
get.summary: Get security group rule details.

get.description: Get a list of all servers inside a project.

200.description: List all servers of a project.

get.summary: List all servers inside a project.

post.description: Create a new server in a project.

requestBody.description: Request a server creation.

delete.description: Delete a server. Volumes won't be deleted.

get.description: Get details about a server by its ID.
get.summary: Get server details.

patch.description: Update name or labels of the server.

requestBody.description: Request an update of a server.

get.description: Get a URL for server remote console.
get.summary: Get server console.

post.description: Deallocate an existing server. The server will be removed from the hypervisor so only the volume will be billed.

get.description: Get server console log.

length.description: Set to 0 to retrieve the complete log.

requestBody.description: Request the server log. By default the length is limited to 2000 lines.

example.output:
Server Console log
with multiple lines

get.summary: Get server log.

delete.description: Detach and delete all network interfaces associated with the specified network from the server.

204.description: Detach and delete network interface was accepted.

delete.summary: Detach and delete all network interfaces associated with the specified network.

post.description: Create and attach a network interface from the specified network to the server.

202.description: Create and attach network interface was accepted.

post.summary: Create and attach a network interface from the specified network.

get.description: Get all network interfaces attached to the server.
get.summary: Get all network interfaces.

delete.description: Detach a network interface from a server.

204.description: Network interface detachment request was accepted.

put.description: Attach an existing network interface to a server.

202.description: Network interface attachment request was accepted.

delete.description: Dissociate a public IP on an existing server.

204.description: Detach Public IP from server was accepted.

delete.summary: Dissociate a public IP from a server.

put.description: Associate a public IP to a server.

202.description: Attach Public IP to server was accepted.

put.summary: Associate a public IP to the server.

post.description: Reboot the server. A soft reboot will attempt to gracefully shut down the server by passing the command to the operating system. A hard reboot will power cycle the server without waiting for the operating system to shutdown properly.

parameters.description: Defines if it is a soft or a hard reboot.
parameters.name: action

post.description: Rescue an existing server. It is shutdown and the initial image is attached as the boot volume, while the boot volume is attached as secondary volume and the server is booted.

requestBody.description: Request a server rescue.

post.description: Resize the server to the given machine type.

requestBody.description: Request a resize of a server.

delete.description: Remove a server from a attached security group.

204.description: Security group detachment request was accepted.

delete.summary: Remove a server from a security group.

put.description: Add an existing server to an existing security group.

202.description: Security group attachment request was accepted.

put.summary: Add a server to a security group.

get.description: Get the list of the service accounts of the server.
get.summary: List all service accounts of the Server.

delete.description: Detach an additional service account from the server.

200.description: Service account detached from the server.

delete.summary: Detach a service account from a server.

put.description: Attach an additional service account to the server.

201.description: Service account attached to the server.

put.summary: Attach service account to a server.

post.description: Start an existing server or allocates the server if deallocated.

Stops an existing server. The server will remain on the Hypervisor and will be charged full price for all resources attached to it. The attached resources will remain reserved. Useful particularly for vGPU servers.
Unrescue an existing server. The original boot volume is attached as boot volume of the server and the server is booted up.

get.description: Get a list of all volume attachments of a server.
get.summary: List all volume attachments of a server.

delete.description: Detach an existing volume from an existing server.
delete.summary: Detach a volume from a server.

get.description: Get the details of an existing Volume Attachment.

200.description: Get details about a volume attachment.

get.summary: Get Volume Attachment details.

patch.description: Update the properties of an existing Volume Attachment.

requestBody.description: Request a volume attachment update.

200.description: Response to update call. Provide the updated volume attachment object.

put.description: Attach an existing volume to an existing server.

requestBody.description: Request a volume attachment creation.

put.summary: Attach a volume to a server.

get.description: Get a list of all volumes inside a project.
get.summary: List all volumes inside a project.

post.description: Create a new volume in a project. If a volume source is not provided, an empty volume will be created. The size property is required if no source or an image source is provided.

requestBody.description: Request a volume creation.

delete.description: Delete a volume inside a project. The deletion will fail if the volume is still in use.

204.description: Volume delete request has been accepted.

get.description: Get details about a block device volume.
get.summary: Get details about a volume.

patch.description: Update name, description or labels of the volume.

requestBody.description: Request an update of a volume.

post.description: Update the size of a block device volume. The new volume size must be larger than the current size.

requestBody.description: Request a volume resize.

post.summary: Update the size of a volume.
